description: The IPIP-BFFM (International Personality Item Pool - Big Five Factor Markers) is a widely used 50-item questionnaire designed to measure the five broad domains of personality: Extraversion, Agreeableness, Conscientiousness, Emotional Stability (Neuroticism), and Intellect/Imagination (Openness to Experience).
scale_description: Each item is rated on a 5-point Likert scale.

questions.text: I am the life of the party.
I feel little concern for others.
I do not talk a lot.
I am relaxed most of the time.
I have difficulty understanding abstract ideas.
I make a mess of things.
I am not interested in abstract ideas.
I am not interested in other people's problems.
I get chores done right away.
I often forget to put things back in their proper place.
I do not have a good imagination.
I talk to a lot of different people at parties.
I am not really interested in others.
I change my mood a lot.
I am quick to understand things.
I do not like to draw attention to myself.
I take time out for others.
I do not mind being the center of attention.
I spend time reflecting on things.
I make people feel at ease.
I am exacting in my work.

scoring_and_interpretation.scoring_method: Each trait has 10 items. Items are rated on a 5-point Likert scale (1=Very Inaccurate, 5=Very Accurate). For 'reverse_scored: false' items, the score is taken directly. For 'reverse_scored: true' items, the score is reversed (e.g., 1 becomes 5, 2 becomes 4, 3 remains 3, 4 becomes 2, 5 becomes 1). The sum of the scores for the 10 items within each trait gives the total score for that trait (ranging from 10 to 50).

trait_dimensions.name: Extraversion
trait_dimensions.description: Characterized by positive emotions, assertiveness, gregariousness, activity, excitement-seeking, and warmth. Reflects how much someone seeks and enjoys social interaction and external stimulation.
trait_dimensions.high_score_interpretation: Highly outgoing, sociable, energetic, talkative, and enjoys being the center of attention. Tends to be assertive and seeks excitement.
trait_dimensions.low_score_interpretation: More introverted, reserved, prefers solitude or smaller groups, may be quieter and less assertive.

trait_dimensions.name: Agreeableness
trait_dimensions.description: Characterized by being compassionate, cooperative, kind, trusting, empathetic, and generally amiable. Reflects how much someone values getting along with others.
trait_dimensions.high_score_interpretation: Compassionate, good-natured, cooperative, trusting, and empathetic. Tends to be polite and avoids conflict.
trait_dimensions.low_score_interpretation: More competitive, skeptical, may be more direct or assertive, and less concerned with pleasing others.

trait_dimensions.name: Conscientiousness
trait_dimensions.description: Characterized by self-discipline, organization, dutifulness, diligence, planning, and dependability. Reflects how much someone is goal-directed and orderly.
trait_dimensions.high_score_interpretation: Organized, responsible, detail-oriented, hard-working, disciplined, and aims for high achievement. Follows plans and meets deadlines.
trait_dimensions.low_score_interpretation: More spontaneous, less structured, may be disorganized, and might procrastinate or be less reliable.

trait_dimensions.name: Emotional Stability
trait_dimensions.description: Reflects emotional calmness, resilience to stress, and absence of negative emotions (e.g., anxiety, anger, depression). This is the inverse of Neuroticism.
trait_dimensions.high_score_interpretation: Generally calm, relaxed, resilient to stress, and emotionally stable. Seldom worried or easily upset. (Low Neuroticism)
trait_dimensions.low_score_interpretation: Prone to negative emotions, easily stressed, anxious, moody, and may experience emotional volatility. (High Neuroticism)

trait_dimensions.name: Intellect/Imagination
trait_dimensions.description: Often referred to as Openness to Experience. Characterized by intellectual curiosity, creativity, aesthetic appreciation, imagination, and a preference for variety.
trait_dimensions.high_score_interpretation: Highly imaginative, intellectually curious, open to new ideas and experiences, artistic, and enjoys abstract concepts. Tends to be original and insightful.
trait_dimensions.low_score_interpretation: More conventional, practical, less interested in abstract or artistic pursuits, and prefers familiarity over novelty.

score_ranges_general.low: 10-23 (Lower than average manifestation of the trait)
score_ranges_general.high: 38-50 (Higher than average manifestation of the trait)

scoring_and_interpretation.important_disclaimer: The IPIP-BFFM is a self-report measure and provides insights into broad personality traits. It is not intended for clinical diagnosis. Professional psychological assessment and interpretation should be conducted by a qualified expert. These general score ranges are illustrative and not based on specific population norms; interpretation should consider individual context.
